title: TIROTEO EN PERRIS, CA
content:
Five men and women were injured in a drive-by shooting outside a restaurant and nightclub in Perris early Sunday, Nov. 3, authorities said.
The shooting was reported as the business was closing shortly before 2 a.m. in the 2900 block of Perris Boulevard, a Riverside County sheriff’s officials said. A large group of patrons were leaving when someone in a light-colored, four-door compact car drove by and opened fire, Sgt. Ryan Hoxmeier said.
A security guard returned fire, striking the car as it sped away.
Deputies arrived to find four people suffering from gunshot wounds. They were taken to a hospital for treatment.A fifth person with a gunshot wound was found later at an area hospital, Hoxmeier said.
Though the victims were shot in the limbs and torso — and some required surgery — sheriff’s officials said their injuries were not life-threatening.
Hoxmeier said it appeared there had been some fighting among club patrons earlier in the night and the shooting might have stemmed from that. Though the people who were shot do not appear to have been involved in the fights, he said.
Investigators served a search warrant Sunday in the 26500 block of Ethanac Road in Menifee where they found the car used in the shooting.
As of Monday morning, no arrests had been made.
Authorities ask that anyone with information call investigators at the sheriff’s Perris Station at 951-210-1049.
